did.unittitle: Harry and Gladys Auerbach Collection of Nicholas U. Comito Sketches

physdesc.extent: in 2 folders in a shared manuscript box

did.abstract: Nicholas U. Comito (1909-1990) graduated from New York University's School of Commerce in 1930 and became an artist. Harry and Gladys Auerbach owned Comito's sketches and displayed them in their home. The Harry and Gladys Auerbach Collection of Nicholas U. Comito Sketches (circa 1930) consists of 8 sketches of NYU's Washington Square and University Heights campuses. The Washington Square campus sketches include drawings of the Washington Square Arch, the park, and Judson Memorial Church. The sketches of the University Heights campus depict the Hall of Fame for Great Americans.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Nicholas U. Comito (1909-1990) graduated from New York University's School of Commerce in 1930. He later studied at the National Academy of Design School in Italy and became an artist. During World War II, he served at Randolph Field in San Antonio, Texas as a member of the Army Air Corps. While at Randolph Field, Comito learned lithography under the tutelage of Alice Naylor. Between 1943 and 1944, his artwork was exhibited at the Dallas Museum of Art's Third and Fifth Annual Texas Print Exhibition. Comito became known for his landscape and still life paintings; illustrations; and lithography.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Harry Auerbach (1911-1999) served as a member and former President of the Brae Burn Country Club. He was also a Partner at H.J. Behrman and Company, LLP. He may have been a graduate of NYU. Gladys Auerbach (1917-2005) was a board member of United Cerebral Palsy of New York City. Harry and Gladys Auerbach owned the sketches found within this collection and displayed them for over 60 years in their homes in the Bronx, Stuyvesant Town, and Rye, New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Harry and Gladys Auerbach Collection of Nicholas U. Comito Sketches (circa 1930) consists of 8 sketches of NYU's Washington Square and University Heights campuses. The Washington Square campus sketches include drawings of the Washington Square Arch, the park, and Judson Memorial Church. The sketches of the University Heights campus depict the Hall of Fame for Great Americans.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Nicholas U. Comito sketches were originally owned by Harry and Gladys Auerbach and were donated to the University Archives in 2007 by Ken and Susan Auerbach (NYU '69), Harry and Gladys' children. The accession number associated with this collection is 2024.052.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Materials in this collection were transferred from the New York University Archives Photograph Collection (PHOTO 00001) in June 2024.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: In June 2024, Nicholas U. Comito's sketches were removed from the New York University Archives Photograph Collection (PHOTO 00001) and a new collection was created, MC 408. Materials were rehoused in an acid-free box and folders. Materials were described on the collection-level and inventoried at the file-level.
